key_insight: eMOSAIC combines multimodal protein–compound representations with per-sample out-of-distribution (OOD) uncertainty estimates to substantially improve binding affinity predictions across multiple targets, enabling more reliable polypharmacology assessment.
problem_solved: Accurately predicting drug–target binding affinities under distribution shift and for compounds that act on many proteins is undermined by miscalibrated predictions and lack of per-sample OOD awareness; this work addresses unreliable generalization and decision-making in multi-target screening.
method: Multimodal modeling: integrate molecular (compound) and protein representations to predict binding affinity under a unified model.
Per-sample OOD uncertainty quantification: estimate individual prediction uncertainty for each compound–protein pair to detect domain shift and flag low-confidence predictions.
Use uncertainty-aware outputs to improve ranking/prioritization for polypharmacology (e.g., downweight or defer high-uncertainty predictions), yielding more robust affinity predictions.
impact: Provides a practical blueprint for building uncertainty-aware multimodal models that generalize under domain shift—helpful for ML practitioners deploying predictive models in drug discovery where reliable, per-sample confidence is critical for decision-making.
visual_elements: Schematic diagram: input modalities (compound SMILES/graph + protein sequence/structure) → eMOSAIC model → affinity + per-sample uncertainty.
Calibration/uncertainty plot: reliability diagram or expected calibration error showing improved calibration vs baselines.
Heatmap or bar chart: predicted affinities across many targets with uncertainty overlays to highlight confident polypharmacology hits.
UMAP/t-SNE: embedding showing in-distribution vs OOD examples color-coded by uncertainty.
paper_title: Multimodal out-of-distribution individual uncertainty quantification enhances binding affinity prediction for polypharmacology
paper_authors: Amitesh Badkul, Li Xie, Shuo Zhang, Lei Xie
